ptserver.data

Class RemoteEventToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptolemy.data.Token
      • ptserver.data.RemoteEventToken

  • public class RemoteEventToken
extends Token
    Encapsulates an informational token raised by the proxy model infrastructure.
    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Justin Killian
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (jkillian)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (jkillian)

      • RemoteEventToken

        public RemoteEventToken(RemoteEventToken.EventType eventType,
                        java.lang.String message)
        Initialize the token with a name and event type.
        Parameters:
        eventType - The type of event to alert the user of.
        message - The accompanying message to explain the event.

      • RemoteEventToken

        public RemoteEventToken(java.lang.String message,
                        java.lang.Throwable exception)
        Initialize the token when an exception has occurred.
        Parameters:
        message - The accompanying message to explain the event.
        exception - Exception thrown by the active simulation.

    • Method Detail

      • getEventType

        public RemoteEventToken.EventType getEventType()
        Get the type of notification sent to the user.
        Returns:
        The type of the notification.

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        Get the informational message associated with the token.
        Returns:
        The informational message provided to the user.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: Token
        Return the value of this token as a string that can be parsed by the expression language to recover a token with the same value. This method should be overridden by derived classes. In this base class, return the String "present" to indicate that an event is present. If this token is Token.NIL then return "nil"
        Overrides:
        toString in class Token
        Returns:
        The String "present", unless this token is Token.NIL, in which case return the String "nil".
